column5: Hi Folks,  I'm heading to Port Maitland tomorrow - was just curious on what type of fish can be caught there this time of year? what baits work best? I know from last time, people were catching A LOT of DRUMS... Any other species found in the area?  Any input will be greatly appreciated! Thanks All! A2F (Rob)
Perch, white bass, drum and smallies
what bucktail said, lots of drum, the occasional white bass and lots of smallies off the opposite side.
Cats and carp, the odd bowfin, pike, perch....
Haha!! I caught my PB Freshwater Drum outta there yesterday!!  Pics to come soon!! Just waiting on my friend to email them to me...
Great to here & congrats on your PB SBK

I talked to a few guys that cast at night around 1&2 am for Walleye. I went one night, but the waves were busting over the pier, so much for that.   Take a lantern. My thought on that time, my head likes the pillow.
